job_title: Data Scientist Financial Services - Customer Success
job_description:
Data Scientist - Customer Success

Ayasdi is pioneering a newer way to understand large and complex data using Topological Data Analysis (TDA) to automatically discover insights. We use TDA to unify cutting-edge machine learning approaches into a common framework without the need to write algorithms, queries or models. We’re building a platform to solve some of the world’s most complex data problems and are seeking you to join our Customer Success Team as a Data Scientist.

Working closely with exceptionally smart people you will balance your creative mindset with your technical knowledge to solve complex problems in new and innovative ways for some of the largest and most complex financial services challenges today and tomorrow. You will use our techniques in combination with advanced statistical and machine learning methods to solve customer problems as well as assist with prototyping new products and solutions.



Through innovative, high-quality, and analytical solutions you will transform our clients by demonstration and delivery of the Ayasdi product into powerful users of Ayasdi solutions. As our Ayasdi SME you will create sustainable, high quality and actionable results.

You will serve as an Ayasdi SME on product functionality that meets customer solutions scope. You will work on all aspects of the implementation process including participation in the sales presentations, defining scope of work and requirements gathering.

We are currently partnered up with a market leading Analytics Consultancy who are expanding their London Data Science Quantitative Team. As such they are seeking Data Science Quants who have experience working withing a banking environment to join them on a multitude of projects.
They are still looking to hire multiple data science quantitative consultants from strong banking, statistical and software programming backgrounds into the business on a permanent basis. This will range from Analyst to Manager level within the Banking Analytics & Quantitative Advisory Practice.

Ferrero, the world’s third largest confectionary company and a major player within the FMCG space, is the home of leading brands like Ferrero Rocher, Nutella, Kinder, Thornton’s, Tic Tac and many other iconic products.
We have an amazing opportunity for an Brand Intelligence Analyst to join the team based in Greenford, North West London, which has great tube and bus links plus a free staff car park.

The Role

Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Bradford or Chippenham

Salary: Competitive dependent on experience

Contract Type: Permanent

Hours: 37.5

**About Us**

Anchor Hanover Group is the largest provider of specialist housing and care for people in later life in England, employing more than 9,000 people throughout England. We provide more than 60,000 homes for older people, and are a trusted care provider with more than 100 care homes.

We know that quality services start with quality people. We work hard to be recognised as a leading employer and are committed to retaining and attracting the best in our industry.

At Anchor Hanover Group we believe in values. We are Accountable, Respectful, Courageous and Honest. We believe our people should be proud of the work they do making a difference to society and our customers.

**About the role**

You will take ownership for accessing and fully utilising all systems employed, deployed and adopted by the Property Department in the conduction of day to day and emergency business; inputting as necessary, interrogating, tracking performance and identifying issues.

Working with key colleagues in Asset Management & Compliance you will generate and dovetail information required to complete business processes around stock performance, the estate, planned works programmes and compliance.

A key aspect of the role is gathering, understanding and documenting detailed business information using appropriate tools and techniques, providing property management intelligence that will enable the company to progress both external and internal projects.

You will be responsible for designing and implementing database technologies, as well as translate large datasets into meaningful reports and communicate this confidently to all stakeholders.

**About you**

You must have previous experience producing KPIs, forecasting works and budgets and management information. You will have a property maintenance or asset management or similar technical background.

You will have knowledge of stock condition databases and stock performance modelling tools, repair & maintenance systems, e.g. Northgate, Promaster, APEX, ARK, Saville’s APE, etc and have transferable knowledge to associated Data engines, interfaces eg. BARIS

You will be proficient in the use and management of complex relational databases with excellent analytical and numerical skills, and ability to critically examine data to extract meaningful insights and be able to communicate findings clearly to non-technical colleagues.

Excellent IT skills is essential particularly Excel and MS Project as is the ability to prioritise, pro-actively problem solve and have a keen eye for detail.

Hundreds of talented professionals with a range of specialist skills and experience based in our Bradford and London offices make up our Support Services. While we all do very different things, we work towards the same goal of improving the lives of the older people who live with us.

As England’s largest not-for-profit provider of care and housing for older people, we’re able to negotiate great deals and benefits for our people. Here are just a few of the things you’ll get when you work with Anchor.

Data Scientist will build analytics capabilities in revenue generating areas including: existing and new digital products, direct consumer advertising models, patient and clinical trial recruiting, sales efficacy, and related areas.

The data scientist's primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems. job_description:
Summary

You will work on developing innovative data-driven solutions to bring customer value and better insights. This would involve undertaking transformative Machine Learning, Data Analytics and Data Mining projects in on-line payments and financial messaging for a leading, global fin-tech. You will also be called upon to provide mentorship to lesser experienced colleagues.



We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist who is passionate about data and deriving value for our business and our customers using this data. The analytics team develops and applies advanced machine-learning techniques and algorithms to solve problems for online payments and financial messaging. This is an exciting time to be joining this team of Data Scientists as it transitions from deployed data-bases to a full-fledged cloud-based working environment. The essential functions in this role are:







Education and Experience

Overview

Join Supersolid’s data analytics team, and take a key role in the continued growth of our live games and the successful launches of new games. With your analysis, our teams (product, marketing, art, engineering etc.) will make better informed decisions. We also continually re-evaluate our analytics stack, aiming to have an industry-leading approach. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on a highly respected and fast-growing mobile games studio.
You will be working especially closely with senior management, data analysts, product managers, and the marketing team. You will help develop regular reports but also help lead deeper explorative analyses to directly shape the future direction of our games. The ability to clearly articulate hypotheses, run complex SQL queries to mine the wealth of data we collect, and present findings and suggestions is also critical to the role. You will be expected to be proactive in contributing data-backed recommendations for our gaming titles.






Apply

If you are interested in joining Supersolid, please email us below!

Please note that you need to be entitled to work in the UK. If you are not sure about your eligibility, please find out more information about working in the UK from GOV.UK.

The Data & Statistics Team Is a Quantitative Research Team That Has a Number Of Core Areas Of Focus Including

Oxford Policy Management (OPM) is delighted to announce that we are looking to recruit a Consultant to join our Data & Statistics Portfolio .

The delivery of impact evaluations involving experimental or quasi-experimental methods, including randomised controlled trials, propensity score matching, synthetic control, regression discontinuity, difference-in-difference, and interrupted time-series techniques; The delivery of quantitative to provide high quality evidence on the quality and efficacy of programme implementation in support of adaptive management; A that seeks to test and introduce data innovations across the data cycle, including exploiting big and non-traditional data sources and exploring the use of analytical techniques derived from modern data sciences; and To support survey teams based in our International Offices to ensure that and provides data that is robust and is appropriate to inform both research requirements and to inform policy decisions.
OPM has undertaken quantitative analytical work across a range of thematic areas including education, social protection, nutrition, health, water and sanitation, climate change, and resilience and livelihoods. In fact a core competitive advantage is that OPM also has a large range of thematic teams with whom we work in close collaboration for the delivery of robust and policy relevant quantitative analytical work.

The majority of our research is designed within a . The integration of qualitative research in our analytical approaches helps understand the ‘how’ and ‘why’ questions and provides a more holistic understanding by addressing gaps that purely quantitative methods cannot fill.

Our quantitative analytical practice is growing and this is an exciting opportunity to join our Data & Statistics Portfolio. This role will suit someone with post-graduate level training and advanced technical knowledge in quantitative analysis for Monitoring and Evaluation.



OPM is committed to helping low- and middle-income countries achieve growth and reduce poverty and disadvantage through public policy reform.

We are driven by development impact and our belief that good public policy can transform the lives of millions of people. That’s why we work with governments in low- and middle-income countries to help enable change where it’s needed most. We do this by working hand-in-hand with our clients and partners to help shape projects and policy making in a way that maximises lasting, positive change and builds local capabilities over the long term.

Since our beginnings in 1979, we have grown into a global organisation with a network of offices supporting policy making around the world. We have expanded our capabilities over the years to take an integrated approach across the policy cycle, allowing us to make the most pragmatic recommendations. Today, we work in all areas of social and economic policy and governance, including health, finance, education, water, energy, climate change and public sector management.

OPM’s approach is rooted in a thorough understanding of the complete policy cycle. We work with policy makers to research evidence, develop public policy, support its implementation and evaluate its impact. This holistic view enables us to provide integrated support which is both practically and politically feasible – essential ingredients for long term change.

We are both thinkers and doers, meaning that we combine our academic thinking with concrete experience. Analytical rigour is in our DNA, and is focussed on real-life application and delivery. We learn from real-world effects and build evidence to inform choices.



including defining analysis plans, leading scoping visits, designing sampling strategies, developing instruments, overseeing data collection, designing and carrying out analysis, and disseminating results through written reports, briefing notes, and presentations. to quantitative monitoring and evaluation projects being led by other teams in OPM. development activities, including developing technical resources such as standardised approaches and tools. to more junior team members, and deliver internal training seminars to contribute to the wider company’s technical development in quantitative analysis. development activities, including developing academic journal articles out of project work, presenting at academic conferences, and actively engaging with the global monitoring and evaluation community. , including writing the technical and management sections, review draft proposals, identifying experts and team leaders, and creating proposal budgets. through the delivery of monitoring and evaluation projects.



Existing right to work in the UK Degree and post-graduate qualification in a relevant discipline (economics, development economics or other appropriate social science discipline) Graduate level training and advanced quantitative technical knowledge preferably including in experimental and quasi-experimental designs and econometric analysis Experience leading or conducting quantitative monitoring and evaluation projects At least 3 years of quantitative monitoring and evaluation experience Fluency working in Stata Experience working in developing countries Ability to travel overseas for short-term assignments



Familiarity with qualitative and mixed-methods designs Demonstrated experience in developing and delivering training on quantitative impact evaluations and other quantitative analysis techniques. Fluency working in other statistical packages such as R and Python. Experience in using and applying innovative data science techniques in areas relevant to OPM’s work, such as e.g. machine learning methods for predictive analytics, wrangling and analysis of large datasets using cluster computing, and creating interactive and shareable dashboards for data visualisation. Ability to work in at least one relevant language other than English Experience of project management, including the management of project teams
The position is full-time and based in our offices in Oxford with some overseas travel. If you would like to work in a supportive environment that values collaboration, integrity, and empowerment we would love to hear from you. OPM offer a competitive salary, a contribution pension scheme, and generous holiday entitlement.

job_description:
Group Data Analytics is a new and exciting discipline in the Technical and Sustainability (T&S) function of Anglo American. The work of the discipline is aimed at better leveraging our data to deliver new insights, value, and smarter ways of working from discovery to market.

Job Description

What you’ll do:

Reporting to the Head of Data Science, and as part of an innovative and energetic team, you’ll partner with our global Business Units and Group Technical Functions to lead on developing statistical models and machine learning algorithms to extract value from our technical and business data.





:







This role is in Technical and Sustainability (T&S) – Data Analytics at a Band 5 level reporting to the Head of Data Science.



Bachelor’s degree and Ph.D. in relevant field - Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science



The purpose of Technical & Sustainability (T&S) in Anglo American is to represent and drive the future of mining, as the technical experts and innovators of the company – and industry. The T&S function is globally located and works in partnership with Business Units and other Group functions, to safely ensure technical and operational excellence that delivers to the company’s growth and sustainability ambitions and clear societal purpose.



Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.



Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.



When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programs, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company and we’re still growing all the time.





To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of the process

Job DescriptionAs a Data Analyst, you'll join a 20+ technical team responsible for supporting our customers in all aspects of the Webaspx software and our related products. You will be based in our York office, located on the York University campus. There are excellent transport links to York City Centre and beyond. Free parking is available on-site. Data Analyst Responsibilities: As a Data Analyst you will undertake tasks such as gathering and analysing data, building and validating models, interacting with customers to ensure the best quality of service and delivering operational routes with documentation. Data Analyst Requirements:

Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. We’ve thrilled gamers since 1994, when we launched the original PlayStation. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in interactive and digital entertainment. The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Worldwide Studios (WWS) is the game development division of Sony PlayStation and is responsible for developing some of the most recognisable and ambitious console games and franchises, including Uncharted, The Last of Us, Horizon, God of War, and Gran Turismo.

The WWS Game Analytics team works with some of the best game studios in the world, and use data to help them make their games even better. We are looking for hardworking and passionate people to join us in pushing the boundaries of analytics for PlayStation games.

As a Data Scientist in Game Analytics, you'll:

provide reporting, analysis, tools, and guidance to partner teams

techniques to derive insights on the player experience

design deployments and pipelines
- Work with partners to understand their goals, find opportunities, and inform
decisions about features and games across the company

evangelise with the team where relevant

We'd love to hear from you if:

- You are passionate about games and using data to improve games and player experiences
- You're looking for a fast-paced, dynamic environment to take on new challenges
- You have strong experience in teasing out insights from customer behaviour data to inform decisions and improve products
- You have a solid background in math and statistics
- You have a Master's degree or equivalent in Math, Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Statistics, or related field
- You have at least two years of data science experience
- You are proficient in modern machine learning techniques, Python, and SQL
- You have excellent communication skills, and the ability to convey results and insights to people with a variety of backgrounds in a clear, concise and unambiguous way

CK Group is recruiting for a Data Analyst to join a company in the pharmaceutical industry at their site based in Leeds on a contract basis for 6 months and has a hourly rate of £14.55 PAYE

The Company

Our client is a multinational medical devices, pharmaceutical and consumer packaged goods manufacturing company who offer the worlds most comprehensive portfolio of orthopaedic and neuro products and services for joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neuro, cranio-maxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials.

job_description:
Dimensions is proud to be one of very few social care organisations that
are members of the Great Places To Work programme.
We are looking for an enthusiastic Data Analyst / Developer to turn data
into information, information into insight and insight into business
decisions that will deliver Dimensions’ strategic objectives and support
its business operations.
As part of the Data Development Team in the IT Department, the Data Analyst
/ Developer will manage, analyse and report on data supporting Dimensions’
business operations, decision making and delivery of statutory returns.
You will conduct activities across the full data lifecycle covering
requirements analysis and design, the development of analysis and reporting
capabilities, and continuously monitoring performance and quality to
identify improvements.



Your main duties will include:

Interpret data, analyse results using statistical techniques and provide
ongoing reports and reporting capabilities. Design and create data reports
and dashboards, including the presentation of data in charts, graphs,
tables and other visualisations. Identify and acquire relevant data from
multiple primary or secondary data sources. Model and document the types
and structure of the business data.



The successful applicant will have:

Demonstrable experience of working with and querying databases with T-SQL.
Substantial experience of working with Excel using advanced formulas, pivot
tables and charts. Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or
Developer, dealing with large datasets. Adept at report writing and
presenting findings.

discount shopping scheme ‘Rewarding Dimensions’ Employee Assistance
Programme Pension scheme Long Service Awards Qualification scheme Employee
recognition scheme 'Inspiring People' Discounted health and dental cover
Life Assurance Bike to Work Scheme Season Ticket Loan

As Disability Confident Leaders, we guarantee to interview all disabled
applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy - Dimensions has
been awarded this symbol by Jobcentre Plus to recognise our commitment

job_description:
Data Analyst

£27,000 - £32,000

London

Market leading media events business seeks an experienced email marketing analyst to measure email delivery and establish best practice.





You will be responsible for providing marketers and content teams with expert advice, support and guidance in incorporating SEO & Email Deliverability practices into their marketing strategies to get messages into the inbox and deliver amazing marketing experiences.

This role is great for someone who loves communicating with internal customers and helping them solve challenges.

As an SEO & Deliverability expert, you will be working directly with our client’s teams to deliver and manage SEO, IP warm-up plans, proactively monitoring deliverability metrics, and educating internal teams on deliverability best practices. Don't worry if you are not an email deliverability expert yet - in-depth knowledge of this is helpful but not essential.

Working on SEO, email marketing / deliverability best practices. You're excited at this opportunity in this growing sector and absolutely love solving complicated problems where there often isn't a clear solution or quick fix. Improvement-focused you're organised and able to prioritise in a busy environment. You actively seek feedback on what is and isn't working, and proactively suggest initiatives that tackle pain points to increase productivity.

You’ll be close partners with our Technical Support, Marketing, Content, and Data Teams to develop and iterate on strategies that improve both our customer acquisition and marketing strategies.

Job Description
Take responsibility for maintaining, enhancing and extending complex data sets that drive the casualty risk model.
Source, cross-check and integrate new data sources using analytical software packages.
Liaise with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Engage with client teams to provide advice on how to best use the data.
Update and improve technical documents describing data processes for sourcing and updating data. Qualifications

About HungryPanda

HungryPanda is an online food delivery platform aimed to serve overseas Chinese consumers and merchants. Connecting business to consumers via our state of the art online platform and industry-leading delivery service.

Consolidating the end to end value chain of the overseas Chinese food industry to leverage efficiency and scale. Creating business opportunities via our deep reaching business network and consumer data.

Data Science Analyst

Location: London HQ

Salary: Competitive

Job type: Permanent

Our client is a mobile analytics company, is the global standard for measuring real-world mobile network experience. Using billions of measurements collected 24/7 from tens of millions of smartphones, they analyse real-world mobile network experience at the largest scale and frequency in the wireless industry. They believe measuring how the network performs directly through users' eyes is key to building better wireless networks. Their insights are used across the industry by mobile operators, telecoms regulators, equipment manufacturers and analysts. They have done business across six continents and have driven press headlines in 80 countries, in an industry impacting the lives of billions around the world.



Our clients business is built on data. As a key member of their Data Science team, you will be consistently creating new metrics and analysing, interpreting and reporting them to quantify the quality of mobile network operators around the globe.

The Data Science team are architects of numerous data-gathering and interpretation initiatives. For example, in the last year alone we released a voice experience metric, a video experience metric - a first in the industry - and they continue to design new measurements that are key to analysing the experience of mobile customers.

You will model scenarios for producing new metrics as suggested by their Product teams or business stakeholders. You will need to think carefully and laterally, examining possible solutions but always questioning if there is a better way of doing things. It's a process of iteration to get to the solution, supported by the wider technology teams.

Apart from designing new metrics, there is the work associated with collecting billions of data points every day, from their Apps and third-party Apps. A critical aspect of the team is to ascertain the quality of incoming data, understand likely causes of anomalies, build rules that sanitise the data, perform statistical analysis for their Marketing and Sales teams or external clients, and build tools that automate their Data Science analyses.

You will also get exposure many other parts of the business, working and collaborating closely with their Data Engineers, Android & iOS Engineers, QA Engineers and their Product and Program Management functions.

beneficial although we equally like in-house experience

At Co-op, we're proud to be the owners of one of the UK's largest and most varied commercial property portfolios. As the UK's biggest community food retailer and national funeralcare leader we have a complex estate, present in every postal area in Britain. And we're growing. That's why we're looking for a spatial data analyst to help us continue to develop the best property portfolio to serve our customers, colleagues and members.

In this role, you'll play a key part in maintaining and analysing the data we use to find the best locations for our stores and funeral homes. You'll look after large data sets, combining internal and external sources, including demographics, to underpin strategic decisions for our existing and future estate. It's a big job, but if you have the amazing analytical skills and natural curiosity we're after, we can offer you the chance to develop your skills and career in a business that puts people at the heart of its strategy.




* use data from a variety of both internal and external sources to provide insight and inform decision making
* maintain, refresh and develop tools used within L&PP (location and portfolio planning), including data dashboards, forecasting models, and GIS templates

* provide support for the analysis software used within L&PP team, including GIS



* significant experience in an analytical or data driven role
* either a degree in a STEM or related subject, or a proven background using those skills
* advanced computing skills, with a solid knowledge of Microsoft Excel including use of advanced formulas and pivot tables
* excellent numeracy skills and an analytical mind-set
* a keen eye for detail
* excellent communications skills, with the ability to forge meaningful relationships with partners from different areas of the business
* previous experience working with Alteryx or similar analytical software would be ideal, but not essential
* previously worked with customer and/or demographic data, this would be beneficial but not essential



Here you'll do work that matters. We're a commercial organisation with a purpose beyond profit, you'll have an opportunity to help us build a stronger Co-op and stronger communities. You'll also get a package that includes:

* competitive salary
* coaching, training and support to help you develop
* pension with up to 10% employer contributions
* annual incentive scheme
* 28 days holiday (rising to 32 in line with service)
* discounts on Co-op products and services



We're actively building diverse teams and welcome applications from everyone. But simply having a diverse workforce is not enough. We celebrate our differences and recognise the importance of teams reflecting the communities they serve.

We can make adjustments to our interview process according to your needs. And we offer a flexible working environment so you can adjust your hours to suit your personal circumstances. You can find out more about Co-op people policies at coop.co.uk/peoplepolicies.

job_description: Job DescriptionIf you've had your ear to the ground, you'll know it's the perfect time to join Soldo. After Series B funding, we've doubled in size over the last 6 months, and we're not stopping there. Want to help change the way money works for business? We've got fantastic opportunities for bright sparks who are excited by the fintech industry. Our London office is the epicentre of a revolution in business spending - we're looking for movers and rule-breakers to join the cause. Bring your brains, drive and passion to our team and see what you can achieve. This role sits within our growing Data Science and Analytics team who leverage, predict and analyse large data sets. You'll work with senior stakeholders in the business to predict behaviors, run simulations and produce detailed reports to help drive the business make some of its most important decisions. Requirements The ideal candidates have the right attitude to improve grow and educate themselves as we develop our products. Typically we would expect strong skills with a mix of the following;

Songkick is the great live music startup. Since 2007, we've set about making it as easy, fun and fair as possible for you to see your favourite artists live. Right now, more than 20 million music fans across the globe use Songkick each month to track their favourite artists, discover awesome concerts and never ever miss out.

With over 8 million event listings, we're the biggest concert service on the planet. Across web, iPhone, Android, and through rich partnerships with Spotify, Pandora, Facebook and more, Songkick is the definitive and trusted home for live music online.

We always put fans first, and we're on a mission to bring the magic of live music to fans everywhere. We're a small, fast-moving team that cares a lot about our values, that's packed to the brim with digital and industry expertise. We think live music is for everyone, and we're committed to solving real problems for our customers and users that brings innovation to live music, working hard to empower our community and cut out the BS along the way.

We do our best work when we're happy, respectful and relaxed. Our values and work ethic have got us far, and as we grow we'll never shake that small startup feel. And we're well supported on our mission, in 2017 we became part of the Warner Music Group family, opening up epic new realms of opportunities to bring fans and artists closer together.



With so many fans, artists and partners trusting Songkick to make concerts easier for them, it means we have a lot of data about what matters in live music. It's at the core of how Songkick operates: supporting our product development, understanding how we have the most impact on our mission, and shaping the relationships we have with our diverse set of industry partners. Data and insight is a key part that tells us how we can best go about improving the live music experience for everyone.

We're looking to hire a Data Analyst to supercharge our efforts. Working across the company, your remit will be to do everything in your power to better inform us through insights.

I am currently sourcing a Senior Data Scientist for a nationwide organisation based in Coventry. This is an incredibly exciting opportunity to join a competent team of people who share a common goal in improving business performance through data and analytics.

You will be responsible for leading complex projects and initiatives which drive strategic decision-making and generate insights and value from the business's data using Data Science & Business Intelligence tools, technologies and techniques. You will work closely with business functions to understand their challenges and opportunities and coordinate the delivery of solutions in support of member outcomes and the business's strategic plan. You will be required to support the team of Data Scientists to develop understanding of programming and Data Science tools and statistical and mathematical techniques, playing a pivotal role to inspire and establish the organisation’s Data Science capabilities.

The successful Senior Data Scientist will be a true all rounder and will therefore possess the following skill set.

Data Engineering:
o Data profiling and intuition
o Data Modelling
o Data Wrangling
o Data preparation for modelling (standardization, regularization, interpolation)
o Structured data processing (SQL and ETL)
o Unstructured Data Extraction and Processing (Pub/Sub and pipeline programming)
o Big Data and Distributed Data/Cloud (Hadoop and related technologies)
o Knowledge of Data Architecture for Structured and Unstructured data

Advanced Analytics using Mathematics and Statistics:
o Statistical modelling
o Advanced mathematics (calculus, linear and non-Linear regression, logistic regression, and time series analysis models, etc.)
o Mathematical processes for data reduction (dimensionality reduction)
o Following scientific methods for optimization

Data Mining
o Machine Learning
o NLP and Text Mining
o Experience working with AI & deep learning algorithms and large datasets

Data Visualisation:
o Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Excel, Cognos)
o Story-telling
o Communication and presentation skills with the ability to convey complex ideas simply, and with a clear narrative
o Commercial awareness with ability to question and challenge and put forward new ideas
o Stakeholder management skills with the ability to influence and gain buy in through key working relationships

This role is a strong platform to offer career progression and longevity within a well known market leading business.

job_title: 2020 Graduate Scheme, Data Science | Forensic and Litigation Consulting
job_description:
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:

The Forensic & Litigation Consulting practice offers one of the industry's most complete range of advisory services to clients across the world. Our service offerings include anti-money laundering compliance and investigations; Bribery and corruption investigations; forensic accounting; fraud and other financial crime investigations; governance, risk and regulatory advice; regulatory investigations and litigation support and transactional data analytics .

Data Science is a fast-growing team of highly talented data scientists with backgrounds across various disciplines, focusing on applying statistical analysis, stochastic models, machine learning algorithms, and domain knowledge to client and external datasets. With an emphasis on research and development, we specialise in leveraging cloud computing, and advanced cutting-edge algorithms and models to not just extract signals from data, but project into the future. Our clients range from governments to financial institutions to Silicon Valley tech start-ups.

Our interns will be encouraged to voice their thoughts on developing and improving any of our project pipelines, and to be part of the team to complete these tasks. Our projects range from long-term to proof-of-concept in nature, in such diverse areas as litigation support, time-series analysis, geo-spatial modelling, and communications analytics. The spectrum of projects that you will be exposed to should provide you with a holistic impression of life as a data scientist.

















As a Data Scientist with FTI, you'll work alongside people from a range of backgrounds. Within your first year, you will have the chance to work on multiple projects and proof-of-concepts in different domains, with opportunities to specialise according to what interests you. Your colleagues will challenge you, and help you to grow in both technical and business capabilities.

You'll develop advanced machine learning models, leveraging high performance servers within an AWS tech stack to test and deploy your work. With a strong focus on learning and R&D, and an environment that values input from employees of all levels, you'll be expected to put forward your own ideas, and encouraged to upskill in areas that interest you-particularly as we expand our capabilities to include distributed computing and GPU accelerated training.

We also offer you:











FTI Consulting, Inc. is a global business advisory firm dedicated to helping organisations manage change, mitigate risk and resolve disputes: financial, legal, operational, political & regulatory, reputational and transactional. job_description:
I am currently sourcing a Senior Data Scientist for a nationwide organisation based in Coventry. This is an incredibly exciting opportunity to join a competent team of people who share a common goal in improving business performance through data and analytics.

You will be responsible for leading complex projects and initiatives which drive strategic decision-making and generate insights and value from the business's data using Data Science & Business Intelligence tools, technologies and techniques. You will work closely with business functions to understand their challenges and opportunities and coordinate the delivery of solutions in support of member outcomes and the business's strategic plan. You will be required to support the team of Data Scientists to develop understanding of programming and Data Science tools and statistical and mathematical techniques, playing a pivotal role to inspire and establish the organisation’s Data Science capabilities.

The successful Senior Data Scientist will be a true all rounder and will therefore possess the following skill set.

Data Engineering:
o Data profiling and intuition
o Data Modelling
o Data Wrangling
o Data preparation for modelling (standardization, regularization, interpolation)
o Structured data processing (SQL and ETL)
o Unstructured Data Extraction and Processing (Pub/Sub and pipeline programming)
o Big Data and Distributed Data/Cloud (Hadoop and related technologies)
o Knowledge of Data Architecture for Structured and Unstructured data

Advanced Analytics using Mathematics and Statistics:
o Statistical modelling
o Advanced mathematics (calculus, linear and non-Linear regression, logistic regression, and time series analysis models, etc.)
o Mathematical processes for data reduction (dimensionality reduction)
o Following scientific methods for optimization

Data Mining
o Machine Learning
o NLP and Text Mining
o Experience working with AI & deep learning algorithms and large datasets

Data Visualisation:
o Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Excel, Cognos)
o Story-telling
o Communication and presentation skills with the ability to convey complex ideas simply, and with a clear narrative
o Commercial awareness with ability to question and challenge and put forward new ideas
o Stakeholder management skills with the ability to influence and gain buy in through key working relationships

This role is a strong platform to offer career progression and longevity within a well known market leading business.

Here at ASOS, we want to give everyone the confidence to be their best self, because, when you’re at your best, you can achieve amazing things.

Our ASOSers reflect the diverse society they live in; we celebrate our differences and welcome people from all different walks of life. – a unique big data infrastructure that will ingest and serve massive amount of data to power our predictive data products, leveraging the latest in machine learning and AI technologies.

About Us

At Sensyne Health we combine technology and ethically sourced patient data to help people everywhere get better care. To do this, we have created a unique partnership with the NHS that delivers a return to our partner Trusts and unlocks the value of clinical data for research while safeguarding patient privacy. Alongside this, we develop clinically validated software applications that create clinician and patient benefit while providing highly curated data.

We use our proprietary clinical AI technology to analyse ethically sourced, clinically curated, anonymised patient data to solve serious unmet medical needs across a wide range of therapeutic areas, enabling a new approach to clinical trial design, drug discovery, development and post-marketing surveillance.

The Team

We are an agile team of Clinically led data science specialists who use our proprietary clinical AI technology to analyse ethically sourced, clinically curated, anonymised patient data to solve serious unmet medical needs across a wide range of therapeutic areas, enabling a new approach to clinical trial design, drug discovery, development and post-marketing surveillance. The nature of our team is collaborative with an emphasis on genuine passion for healthcare.

As a central member of a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team of scientists passionate about reinventing the way new medicines are developed, you will bring your deep understanding of data science to enhance of ability to perform key research, data visualisation, insgiht gathering and decsion making from big data and real world evidence. Your work with experts in artificial intelligence, deep learning, informatics, statistics, drug discovery and clinical translation/commercialisation will enable us to discover robust clinical insight that will ultimately make a difference to the lives of patients across a range of therapeutic areas.

job_description:
Overview

The Role and Team

The data analytics team at Apetito is working on the exciting strategic agenda to make our business data centric by providing data insights, identifying trends, supporting implementation and evaluating outcomes. This involves exploration into the rich data assets that Wiltshire Farm Foods and apetito have with the exciting new technologies and tools that are now available, to identify new opportunities to deliver superior customer satisfaction and to grow the business.

In your one year placement with the Data Analytics team, you will be an integral part of the team that is working on strategic data analysis and business intelligence projects that enable effective decision making within the organisation. The role offers you an opportunity to support data analytics projects that influence the strategy for the business. You will also hone your skills by applying them to real-life situations, learn, trial and apply emergent technologies and tools and work in a fantastic, closely knit team.





apetito is the UK’s leading supplier of food to the health and social care sectors. Servicing over 400 hospitals, 450 care homes and thousands more through our work with Local Authorities, we produce delicious, nutritious and sustainable meals for people at home or in care. Through our food we look to ‘ to all our customers, up and down the country.



Established in 1958, as a family-owned business, our values sit at the very heart of what we do. We are proud to be a business that ‘, committed to producing ‘. We have developed a range of products designed to ‘for all our customers. We are proud supporters of British food and farming and focus on using the best ‘ sourced produce.

We are driven by a ‘, dedicated to feeding some of the UK’s most vulnerable people, offering healthy and delicious meals to customers across the UK.



As a business which operates within food manufacturing, we believe we have an obligation to make a positive contribution on society. With over 300 products in our range, we ensure our produce is ethically and sustainably sourced, working only with suppliers who share our commitment to making a positive impact.

We’re a proud member of the Ethical Trade Initiative (ETI), a leading alliance of companies, trade unions and NGOs, that promote respect for workers rights globally. All our new suppliers now operate under the ETI’s guidelines.

We are also a member of The UK’s Plastics Pact, an initiative looking to transform the plastic packaging industry in the UK. As part of the initiative, we have committed, along with other ambitious targets, to eliminate unnecessary single-use plastic completely by 2025.

We have also made a commitment to our employees – we’re recognised as an accredited Living Wage employer by the Living Wage Foundation. Joining an elite group of FTSE 100 companies and public sector organisations.



Here at apetito, we take our duty to give back to our local communities and chosen charities very seriously. In 2018, we raised over £30,000 for Alzheimer’s Support and Alzheimer’s Society alone, thanks to the incredible efforts of our employees and charity committee. We also support our communities through the apetito Staff Foundation, which gives financial support to the chosen charitable causes of our staff and their children. Since 2005, we’ve raised over £200,000 for these charities.

Full details of our Undergraduate Placement Programme can be found on our careers pages atPlacements at apetito



Specifically,

analysing customer behaviour, product purchase patterns, customer interactions and business processes to help develop strategies to maximise customer satisfaction and to improve customer acquisition, retention and revenue.

work with your Marketing, Product Management, Operations and CRM colleagues and our Franchise Partners, providing analytical consultancy and championing the understanding and adoption of data insights.

work with large datasets both internal and external - creating queries and analysis directly off the customer database. This would involve developing a wide toolkit, including predictive analytics, SQL, R and PowerBI etc. and you would be expected to quickly learn and apply the latest tools that become available.

you will be expected to build your understanding of our products and systems and to build strong relationships with the stakeholders across the business.



You will be studying towards a degree in computer science/ maths/ statistics/engineering/sciences related discipline with the expectation that you will receive a 2:1 or above and are looking to complete a 12 - month placement as part of your degree - graduating 2022.

We are looking for an enquiring mindset, an aptitude to problem solving and a keen desire to learn new tools and technologies are vital.

Exposure to SQL is desirable but not mandatory at all. However, it is important that you have learnt to code and are quite comfortable with coding in any of the major program languages.

You would need to bring a collaborative mindset and a drive to reach out and work across the business to create new opportunities.

You will often present your ideas to the senior management so excellent communication skills and the confidence to engage with senior managers are vital.

My client use a statical modelling solution, which focuses on understanding what drive's their client's sales and brand health. These allow my client to make recommendations that can drive business improvements.

The clients you would be working with are hugely varied - they work with both large and small companies from a range of industries.





We are looking for an Effectiveness Executive to join a fast growing team. This is an entry level position, so no prior work experience is necessary.


.

Data Analyst

WEX Europe Services (WES) is Europe’s newest fuel card provider, we are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Finance Team at our European Head Office in Crewe Cheshire.

WES is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to support continuous improvement and growth in our Sales functions through the provision of key reporting on sales agent and customer performance.

Our sales model is heavily focused on our Telesales teams attaining new business, via telemarking activity. This is supported by numerous marketing channels and is also complemented by a Field Sales function.

As the Data Analyst focused on Volume you will be reporting on the performance of our sales functions via KPIs, assisting in setting and monitoring performance against sales targets, calculating commissions based on this performance and providing routine and ad hoc information to drive improvement in our new volume performance across all our European offices.

The role requires significant interaction with senior management and our sales teams – both managers and agents. Analysis and reporting requires significant data preparation and cleansing in order to ensure accuracy. Success in this role will come from attention to detail in the data preparation, strong relationships with the in-country sales leaders and the ability to maintain and develop insightful analysis

DIRECT APPLICANTS ONLY, NO AGENCIES.



Location UK - CREWE

Salary Competitive

Job Type Permanent

Job Category FINANCE

Reference Number UKDATAANNEW

Closing Date 28/02/2020

Occupations

Industries

At Jump Trading, solving hard problems with cutting-edge technology is our business. Our Production Engineering team relies heavily on open-source solutions in a large and highly distributed global infrastructure that includes several large high performance computing environments, a large low latency trading infrastructure, and significant supporting infrastructure (both on-premise and cloud). We are looking for a Big Data Engineer to add to our team in London.

Examples of Data Engineer projects currently in progress include a many hundred-TB data warehouse project based on Clickhouse, a migration from a legacy Sybase environment onto MySQL 8, and scaling a small MySQL cluster that at peak times returns >100GiB/sec of data to thousands of clients. At Jump, data engineers "own" many parts of the stack, including embedding with trading and other teams.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about open source database technology, with experience in more than one (for example MySQL, Postgres, Clickhouse, InfluxDB, Prometheus). The candidate will have a good ability to automate (using a language such as Python or Go) and understand the full database system when deployed on Linux. Experience managing ETL pipelines and managing petabyte scale data warehouses is valuable, but not mandatory.

job_description:
Job Reference: 325-A-20-90218
Employer:Department:Digital Location:LeatherheadSalary:£39,332.00-£45,534.00 incl. Fringe HCAS

Are you ready to lead a vibrant and dynamic Digital Health Intelligence team? Why not join Surrey and Borders Partnership NHS Foundation Trust (SABP)

Our Digital Health Intelligence and Digital Health Engagement teams are expanding, so we need a motivated and enthusiastic candidate to innovate and overcome our information challenges. Our goal is to put Insight at the very heart of what we do.

Surrey and Borders, a leading provider of Mental Health, Learning Disability and Drug and Alcohol services for people of all ages in Southern England, employs 2,300 staff across 56 sites, and serves a population of 1.3 million.

We pride ourselves on helping people live their lives well. Our high-quality treatment, support and care focuses on the specific health and social care needs of each person to improve their mental and physical wellbeing. We deliver excellent and responsive prevention, diagnosis, early intervention, treatment and care.

We are seeking confident and passionate individuals who thrive on change and want to make a difference to the lives of the people using our services, for their carers and for our own clinical and support staff as well.

As a Data Scientist, you will use your analytical expertise to draw-out clinical and operational insight from complex digital systems and data sets. You will develop and improve the Trust's understanding of the services it provides to the people of Surrey and North East Hampshire. You will look at the demographic, geographic and clinical profiles of the people who use our services, as well as the supply and demand for the teams who support them. You will also take a wider view of the population analytics to understand the needs of the greater health economy, ensuring that clinicians have access to timely evidence-based analyses, forecasts and predictions.

So, seize the opportunity to shape how Surrey and Borders uses information and business intelligence. Help drive improvement and use your expertise to establish a world-class information service within the SABP. In exchange the trust will provide a competitive renumeration package with excellent opportunities for personal growth, training and development.

Please note that all salaries shown are based on whole time of 37.5 hours per week for non-medical roles and 40 hours per week for medical roles, part time roles are pro-rated accordingly.

The Trust aims to ensure that no job applicant or employee is unfairly disadvantaged on the grounds of race, colour, nationality, ethnic origin, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, transgender, marital status/civil partnership, religion/belief or trade union status. The Trust is committed to the employment and career development of people from ethnic minority backgrounds and people with disabilities.

The Trust would encourage applications from people who have experience of using Mental Health & Learning Disability Services.

We reserve the right to close this post early should we be overwhelmed by applications. Please ensure you submit your application as soon as possible to ensure it is considered in the selection process. If you have a disability and can demonstrate that closing this post early would impact on your ability to submit an application in time, please do not hesitate to contact us to make an offline application within the original timeframe.
Existing work permit holders should be aware that if the post they are applying for is a promotion or with a different Trust, a new work permit application will have to made. We are unable to guarantee the outcome of the decision of the Home Office.

Since October 2017 all of our premises have been smoke free.

Please ensure you read the person specification as your application will be judged against this.

Are you an experienced Data Scientist looking to take responsibility of a growing Fintech start-up in Oxford? If so, Oodle would love to speak to you!

The Team And What You'll Do

Oodles hardworking Data Scientists are central to our growth by developing the business through quantitative analysis techniques using both statistical and machine learning methodologies. It is important to be able to communicate such insights to different business partners and you'll also contribute to how the data analysis platform and technology stack is structured to suit the data science team in the future.







We are a fun and outgoing team who all sit in our Head Quarters in Oxford Science Park. We value getting our hands dirty and waste no time as we bid to change the used-car industry. We work hard to provide an outstanding place to work, and to look after our employees. Oh, and we also offer a best-in-class salary, benefits, a bonus scheme, share options and 25 days paid leave.

Since launching in 2016 we've seen huge growth and success and witnessed 500% growth in 2018 alone which is a trajectory we're set to continue as we bring exciting new products to the market! Inspiring the whole Mars business to adopt data driven decision-making by developing advanced analytics methods is huge in your role. How? By mining vast amounts of data from company databases for insights that will help solve business problems and ultimately make Mars more profitable.

Working in a small multidisciplinary team alongside the Global Analytics, Data Engineering, Business Translation and AI teams, you’ll partner with Product Owners to solve problems that real users face using advanced digital techniques. That also means closely collaborating with users from our segments and markets around the world to find the right problems to solve. More than that, you’ll use this direct user exposure to invent true ‘firsts’. That’s new and emerging approaches that Mars, and maybe even the industry, haven’t seen before.

A big part of your role will be choosing the most appropriate technique, based on business need and available data, to develop custom data models and algorithms. As part of that, you’ll also create processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy. All the time, balancing time to deliver with level of detail and accuracy.

Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

Database, Scientific, Telecom, Telecommunications, Engineer, Engineering, Technology

Are you motivated by using data to explore organisational effectiveness, inform strategic planning and guide operational decision making? Data Scientist / Epidemiologist

To design, produce, and disseminate robust relevant real world data and epidemiological studies in order to drive innovative strategies and aid evidence based decision making by customers across the Prescription Medicine (PM) portfolio. In doing so, to provide epidemiological support to achieve the objectives of the respective Franchise Therapy areas.

£25,000 basic salary with OTE of £28,000
The Würth Group is a leading industrial consumable products provider with over 400 companies and a global workforce of 75,000. Our dedication to quality products and excellent customer service has earned us an enviable reputation and on-going growth. Our divisional Field Sales Consultants sell across four main industries; Automotive, Wood, Metal & Construction. Our aim is to drive sales and grow our business with existing customers and seek out opportunities through new customers.
Position Summary
The successful candidate will analyse all e-Business related data that comes from our customer's interactions with the brand online for both Würth UK and Würth Ire. As part of the role you will have a direct input into the strategy of the e-Business department communicating insights and providing solutions that have demonstrable results.



Define key performance indicators and identify the most relevant data to improve existing reporting.
Interpretation of data and analysis of customer online behaviour so as to make recommendations to influence strategic decision making in the department.
Work with the colleagues responsible for inbound marketing to provide strategic insight backed up by data of current customer behaviour to improve conversion rates and focus budget.
Work with IT colleagues and tracking software platforms to get in place, configure and test different tracking snippets.



Strong quantitative analytical skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
2 years' experience in web analysis, online commerce or related fields.
Advanced knowledge of web analytics platforms such as (GA & PIWIK) and Excel is required.
Knowledge of and experience in GTM is essential with knowledge of Hotjar software advantageous.
The successful candidate will be proactive and must have great communication skills and a can do attitude.
Degree in Business Administration or equivalent advantageous but not essential.
If this sounds like you and you would like to build a career with a modern, progressive company with an eye on the future, apply for this position by clicking the button below. Be a part of the Würth success story; work in a positive environment alongside a multi-national team

Who We Are

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.



You will support the data and analytics team with the enhancement of reporting and by providing insights across multiple clients and verticals. You will research and prepare data analysis, prepare campaign insights and work with clients and internal teams to ensure performance methods and metrics drive client relationships.

Location: Welwyn Garden City

Essential Qualifications
5 GCSEs or equivalent Grade 9-5 (including Mathematics and English Language)

:



We believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives. We are courageous in both decision and action. We believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.

We are proud of who we are, what we do, and how we do it. We are many, working as one across functions, across companies, and across the world.

We are Roche.



Our Product Development Informatics (PDIX) organization is co-creating a better future for patients through technology and information. We are an agile organization that brings together great people who are passionate about technology innovation, and who thrive in dynamic, cross-functional, and mission-driven teams.

Our agile organization is made up of structures called Networks and Chapters. “Networks” comprise business domain and technical experts aligned closely with our Product Development business partners to develop and deliver technology-enabled business strategy. Our “Chapters” are centers of expertise of deeply skilled people deployed for maximum impact. These teams work together to deliver outstanding value to our business, patients, and customers.

As a Data Science apprentice within the PDIX Data and Analytics Chapter, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to solve complex data problems enabling PD to transform data into actionable insights. You will collaborate with IT and business stakeholders to co-create data and analytics enabled solutions that help our teams fulfill our mission: to do now what patients need next.

During this exciting 3-year apprenticeship, you will work towards a fully funded Bachelor’s degree (BSc) in Data Science whilst gaining valuable ‘on the job’ experience and mentoring from our talented experts at Roche.

skills, high quality research publications and excellent programming

Job DescriptionDescription About Signal: Signal has created a platform for analysing text and discovering market intelligence. Our large-scale text analytics system (currently processing more than 3 million documents a day in real-time) unlocks knowledge and insights from unstructured textual data using diverse text analytics and machine learning (ML) components. To do this, we face multiple challenges. For instance, we need near de-duplication in real-time to group similar articles from different publications, or entity disambiguation so that we can identify if, for example, a mention of "apple" refers to the fruit or the tech company. Our media monitoring product, built on top of our technology, is enabling organisations to solve real-time complex information challenges (e.g. "All the news related to IPOs of European technology companies"). We Signallers are friendly and informal people! We don't let formality get in the way of pushing our product, we all have a stake in our success. We have an inclusive environment welcoming the skills and experiences from diverse backgrounds. Together we have created who we are and what we sell. We are proud of our achievements and continue to strive for the unknown. We are a venture-backed company, having secured 12m in its Series B funding round from investors such as GMG Ventures, MMC Ventures, Frontline Ventures, and Reed Elsevier. What will you be doing: Here at Signal all data scientists share one function, which allows us to exchange research questions and experiences through our regular research guild meetings and research seminars. Broadly though, we see a continuum between two profiles: the Research Scientist and the Data Scientist (this role here). While the Research Scientist mostly works on longer-term research projects and has deep expertise on Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Information Retrieval (IR), usually to a PhD/Postdoc level or equivalent professional experience, the Data Scientist is mostly involved in shorter iterations of innovation. While there are different requirements specified below, depending on your interest, you can move along this continuum. As Data Scientist, you will be a core player in the growth of our platform and of the products built on top of it. You will be driving the product's strategy and the roadmap by amplifying the impact that ML and NLP techniques have on the direction of the product. You will work within one of our product teams to innovate , collaborate , and iterate in developing solutions to difficult problems. Our teams are autonomous and cross functional, encompassing every role required to build and improve on our products in the way we best see fit (e.g. UX / UI Designers, engineers, and data scientists). You will help the team discover client problems, explore the feasibility and value of solutions by building proof-of-concepts and prototypes and by conducting offline and online experiments. You will collaborate with other team members on bringing further iterations into the product. You will help your team to set key objectives and results, monitor product metrics, and analyse changes in metrics and user behaviour. Outside of the team, you will inform and influence long-term directions for the wider research strategy of the company. Requirements

Team Overview Ofcom is the independent regulator and competition authority for the UK communications sectors. We regulate TV and radio, fixed line and mobile telecoms, postal services and the radio spectrum.

This role sits in the Policy and Analysis team in Ofcom's Spectrum Group, which is responsible for providing access to the electromagnetic spectrum that enables wireless technologies including TV, mobile, satellite and Wi-Fi. The Spectrum Policy and Analysis team uses market and business analysis to inform our spectrum management policies including work to support our auctions of spectrum and improve mobile coverage in the UK.

Purpose of the Role We are recruiting a Telecommunications Data Analyst to support spectrum policy work through the analysis of field and market information to ensure Ofcom's decisions are grounded in rigorous data analysis and understanding of potential future trends.

The role holder will work with colleagues across a number of Ofcom teams in policy and operational functions to analyse, interpret and contextualise data, to support our decision-making.

Requirements of the Role





Qualifications Most likely to be educated to degree level in a subject with significant quantitative/engineering content, or to have equivalent experience.

Competences

Ability to draw insights from the analysis of different and wide-ranging data sources to address policy and operational problems.

Develops effective working relationships with colleagues, adapting own style and approach when appropriate, to produce high quality analysis and policy ideas.

Communicates technical/professional information clearly to a range of audiences.

Plans work and the involvement of others to ensure key milestones are met, responding to developments in a swift and agile manner.



Further Information

job_description: Job Description: We're currently on the lookout for a Junior Data Analyst who has a methodical and logical approach to join our reporting team. eXPD8 provides professional, high quality field marketing services on behalf of many well-known brands in all the big retailers throughout the UK and the Republic of Ireland. Sitting in our reporting team, you'll manage operational reporting, run daily tasks and processes, resolve queries and support Managers to ensure all report requirements for our clients are delivered. Main Responsibilities:

Data analyst (evaluation)

Salary: £25,217-£28,331 per annum

Bucks New University is an ambitious, modern university; one that is always open to fresh ideas and thinking. Our staff combine the very best professional practice with inspirational teaching and the University is consistently in the top quartile of the NSS for higher education institutions in the UK, exceeding the sector average in almost every area of the survey (NSS, 2019).

This is an exciting time to join the University, with our new University Strategy – Impact 2022 – and our revised values. The University is poised for the next phase in its development as we seek to develop our impact further, enrich the student experience through innovative and employment-focused education, and realign our professional services in support of our strategic aims.

The Strategic Planning & Change directorate reports to the Vice Chancellor and is responsible for co-ordinating the University’s strategic planning function, for overseeing external data returns and for analysing developments in the HE sector. We are currently leading a Business Intelligence programme and are working with the Finance department to create a joined-up planning and budgeting procedure.

Two exciting opportunities have arisen for dynamic graduates to join the Strategic Planning & Change directorate and use statistical analysis to inform university decision-making. The post-holders will encounter data from throughout the university’s span of activities and focus upon patterns of student achievement, using statistical analysis to identify potential impediments to student success and evaluating the effects of efforts to improve student outcomes.

The ideal applicants will have graduated from a discipline with substantial statistical content. Degrees in maths and statistics are suitable but degrees from a broader range of disciplines will be considered, especially if the applicant can demonstrate that they conducted quantitative analysis.

These fixed-term developmental roles will be attractive to graduates seeking careers in management information, business intelligence or in the higher education sector and we will invest in their training on the latest business intelligence tools. Candidates who can combine good communication skills with their capacity for data analysis will have opportunities for career progression within the University.

If you have the qualities and attributes representative of the University’s values and ambition, we would be delighted to hear from you. What you can expect in return are excellent employment benefits including: training, development and research support, a generous holiday entitlement, contributory pension scheme, discounted gym membership and a range of staff discounts with major retailers.

For further information about this role please contact Matt Hiely-Rayner (click apply) or Anna Buckett (click apply).

All applications are to be made in full and online. The University operates an anonymised shortlisting process and therefore any uploaded CV’s or supporting documents must not include your name and personal details.

Closing Date: 9th March 2020

Interview Date: 19th/20th March 2020

Please note that if you do not have permission to work in the UK, Bucks New University will not be able to obtain a Certificate of Sponsorship for you to take up this position. All non EU/EAA candidates must have valid immigration status and/or a UK visa valid for the duration of the contract in order to be considered for this appointment.

Bucks New University is a Disability Confident employer and as such you will be given the opportunity to declare a disability as part of the application process.

performing statistical analysis upon patterns of student activity, identifying factors that affect the student experience and evaluating the effectiveness of efforts to improve student outcomes and wellbeing



This is a developmental role within the business intelligence programme and the University will invest heavily in the right candidate. You will be trained in the usage of data visualisation tools and in the use of tools for building predictive models. There will be opportunities for progress within the business intelligence programme and all intelligence analysts will be supported in their preparation to apply for permanent roles as Business Intelligence Specialists.

Provided with appropriate data from the business intelligence programme, you will perform statistical analysis to discover new truths concerning the student experience. By developing statistical models that predict student outcomes you will analyse the effects of projects and initiatives that are aimed at improvement. Confident in handling and interpreting probabilistic data, you will lead on the interpretation of predictive analytics, drawing on the results of your own models and upon outputs of a tool dedicated to monitoring student engagement, preparing results for colleagues in student services, academic schools, and the University Management Group. Sharing your findings through written reports, presentations, and interactive dashboards, your work will inform University policy and strategy via the Policy & Evaluation Manager.

Müller has been a loved brand in the UK for over 30 years. It’s a household name – and it continues to grow as we invest to make and market an ever-great range of fantastic dairy products. We are currently the 8th most chosen FMCG brand in the UK, picked from supermarket shelves over 208 million times each year.

Müller pride ourselves on offering support to help develop your knowledge and skills. In return for your commitment, drive and enthusiasm, we offer an attractive benefits package within a highly successful European business that offers financial rewards and resources, including bonus scheme, contributory pension, life assurance, generous holiday allowance and a flexible benefits programme.

We are seeking a Marketing Insight and Data Analyst to join our client for a position based in Coventry. If you’re enthusiastic about gathering and applying commercially valuable data and are looking for a company which offers excellent working hours and holiday benefits, training courses and qualifications, and an all-round great environment to work in, then this is the perfect opportunity for you. Salary IRO £35,000 pa.
You will be working in the Marketing Team and be responsible for analysis of customers’ interactions. As a Marketing Insight and Data Analyst you will be responsible for developing the understanding and prediction of customers’ behaviour, interpreting data to describe customers’ interactions, developing reports and dashboards, and delivering commercially valuable analysis and recommendations based on this data.
To be successful in this Data Analyst position we are seeking someone with the following skills –

Please apply asap to be considered for this Data Analyst role

Burberry is making a major investment in expanding our data and analytics capability. Over the last few years we have created a global omni-channel single customer view, built an outstanding and modern analytics platform and developed a small but highly effective analytics and data science team. We’re now ready to build on these foundations by growing both teams, to drive and embed data-inspired decision making across Burberry. 

We are recruiting a Senior Data Scientist to join our fast-expanding data science team and contribute in the exciting roadmap and deliverables of the team, while also managing a small team of Data Scientists.
